page.title: 15A DAY OUT TO CHATHAM, 1985
page.content: I shut the door behind me at 9.30 a.m, ready to go to Samantha's home, which is nearby. By the way my name is Teresa Kujawska. I am around 14 years old and lead a normal life in Strood, South-east of England. By the time I get there, she is already waiting outside her house, dressed up and wearing a little make-up (lipstick and blusher). We walk down to Strood railway station, talking about various topics. We walk through a glass door into a spacious entrance area where, on the right hand side is the ticket office and opposite is a kiosk. We buy our tickets, normally 30p return. The train arrives not long after. We get on and shut the doors ourselves. Inside, the train has seats, arranged in rows opposite one another. The upholstery is checked. continued..
